meanings.definition: To defeat or get the better of by superior cleverness; outsmart
meanings.sent1: The clever fox outwitted the hungry wolf by leading him away from the henhouse.
meanings.sent2: She outwitted her opponent in the chess game by anticipating their every move.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon outwitted the campers by stealing their snacks without them noticing.
meanings.sent4: In the game of wits, she always outwitted her rivals with her quick thinking and sharp mind.
meanings.sent5: The detective outwitted the criminal by setting up a clever trap to catch him in the act.

meanings.definition: To surpass in cleverness or cunning; outsmart
meanings.sent1: The young detective outwitted the experienced thief by using his knowledge of the city's alleys.
meanings.sent2: He outwitted his classmates in the math competition by solving the problems faster than anyone else.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat outwitted the dog by hiding in a box and surprising him when he least expected it.
meanings.sent4: Her strategic mind always outwitted her opponents in the business world, making her a successful entrepreneur.
meanings.sent5: The magician outwitted the audience with his illusions, leaving them amazed and puzzled.
